fields.description: The little plus-in-a-speech-bubble icon is a quite small target area to click for adding a comment. Double-clicking anywhere on the line I want to comment on would be an easier and faster UI action, and I don't think the "select word" default browser behavior for double-click is commonly desired in this limited context.
fields.summary: Add double-click action to add comment (BB-11317)

fields.description: If I want to use side-by-side because it makes the differences clearer to me, that choice should not remove review comments from my view. I want to see both a clearer diff and the review comments I'm responding to at the same time.
fields.summary: Show comments in side-by-side diff (BB-11315)

fields.description:
When I respond to comments on a pull request, fixing issues or doing requested changes, and submit a new commit, that commit gets automatically included in the pull request. This is good, but it results in comments that appear nonsensical because they're shown in the wrong context, especially if significant back and forth discussion develops. Please track which commit each comment is made in and show it in that context.

Doing this well would also require changing the pull request diff view to allow selecting "before" and "after" points at each commit in the pull, rather than only at head. To mitigate the chance of not noticing comments because they're hidden due to not being in the commit you're looking at, track a resolved/unresolved status for each one and prompt with a warning if I try to merge the pull request with any comments still unresolved. An easily accessible list of all unresolved comments (with links to their context locations) would also help.
fields.summary: Show correct context for pull request comments (BB-11314)

fields.description:
GitHub allows to use the [Docker|https://www.docker.com] service at http://registry.hub.docker.com. It would be nice if BitBucker could implement the same.

This is the help text for the Docker service on GitHub:

----
When enabled this will let the Docker Index know when you have made changes to your repository. The Docker Index will then pull down your repository and build your Dockerfile to create a Docker repository and push it onto the Docker Index so that it is available for others to download. When you commit changes to your git Repo the Docker Index will keep the Docker Repository up to date.

In order for this to work correctly, you should have the following:

# Docker Index Account, that is linked to your GitHub account.
# Dockerfile at root of your project directory.

----
fields.summary: Create Docker Hook (BB-11312)

fields.description:
Say, I have two pages in my wiki (using Creole syntax) :

* doc/first
* doc/second

If I want my "doc/first" page to contain link to "doc/second", I'd like write link as follows: {{[[second|my second page]]}}. But unfortunately it doesn't work. Instead, I should specify full path to my page every time: {{[[doc/second|my second page]]}}. This is actually wrong; relative path should be relative to current page, not to root of the wiki.

In the markdown, it works properly. Say, if page "doc/first" contains the following: {{[my second page](second)}}, it becomes correct link to my "doc/second" page.

There is my test repo, just in case: https://bitbucket.org/dfrank/test/wiki/doc/second
fields.summary: Creole wiki: relative paths should be relative to current page, but they are relative to wiki root

fields.description:
We have a job to verify pull request build status before merge and we set flag "requires at least 1 successful build". But the 'successful' build status is not getting cleared if pull request was updated with new commits. This is misleading and comprises merge safety. We have accepted several pull requests which broke our build although they obviously should not pass this check and should not be allowed to merge. Please fix it.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Work+with+pull+requests?focusedCommentId=658179174#comment-658179174

the issue is essentially similar to BCLOUD-7042 (BB-6784)
fields.summary: Clear "successful builds" flag if new commits were made under pull request

fields.description:
These PowerShell related extensions are text files, so if they are regarded as binary in BitBucket, then please make them text:

* .PS1 – Windows PowerShell shell script
* .PSD1 – Windows PowerShell data file (for Version 2)
* .PSM1 – Windows PowerShell module file (for Version 2)
* .PS1XML – Windows PowerShell format and type definitions
* .CLIXML - Windows PowerShell serialized data
* .PSC1 – Windows PowerShell console file
* .PSSC - Windows PowerShell Session Configuration file

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_PowerShell#File_extensions

Notes:

# the extensions are _case insensitive_ (I know that Git and Mercurial/HG are case sensitive, so it might be needed to include the permutations of uppercase/lowercase letters in these extensions)
# often _these files are stored with Unicode BOM U+FEFF_ (as edited by either PowerShell ISE, PowerGUI, NotePad or other Unicode aware text editors)

An _example file_ that fails is mentioned at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/330206/why-is-this-ps1-file-being-downloaded-from-my-hg-repository and available from  https://bitbucket.org/jeroenp/besharp.net/src/b356056dbf9189ec8297aeaa5575f8e4092fba65/Scripts/NoIP/Login-and-Update-NoIp.ps1

Related to BCLOUD-5453
fields.summary: PowerShell .ps1 files are detected as binary, whereas they are text.

fields.description: Multiple calls to parse_ methods of cDF may result in error if some method has created a vector of the wrong orientation and then tries to concatenate it. The solution is to apply set access methods on the cDF.File_ properties to transform any vector of file names input to row vector.
fields.summary: cDF.File*** should be row vector

fields.description:
It would be great of Bitbucket would allow me to easily ask the owner of a repository to apply my patches from a certain patch queue to it. The process would be as follows:

# A source code repository exists on Bitbucket
# I create a patch queue from it on Bitbucket
# I add patches to it
# And submit a "pull request" to the owner of the source code repository to apply my patches to it
# Bitbucket would assist the owner in applying the patches / allow him to easily turn them into actual commits

The benefit would be, that the user gets the ease of automatically applied pull requests, as well as the useful process of refining his patches in a controlled way without destroying history or creating rebase problems until the owner of the source repository is satisfied with them.

See-Also: https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/bbs/problem-report-12369
fields.summary: "Pull request" to apply patches in a patch queue to the original repository (BB-11303)
Mistreatment of Image Followed by Hyperlink (Markdown Parser) (BB-11302)

fields.description:
When creating a new issue, it is time-consuming when the issue relates to a version not currently added to the repository. One has to either abort the issue creation, or create it with an incorrect version identifier, then visit the repository settings page and create a new version identifier. Then either return and correct the previous issue's related version, or create a new issue entirely.

It would be an improvement to workflow if new version identifiers _could be created_ when setting the version. They would then be available for other issues, as usual.
fields.summary: Feature to allow creation of version identifiers when creating a new issue (BB-11301)

fields.description: When a repository has no commits to branch from, we shouldn't show the Create Branch button.
fields.summary: As a Supporter, I would like the Create Branch button to be disabled if a Repo does not contain any commits (BB-11143)

fields.description:
Hi there,\\
we have a repo ([click me|https://bitbucket.org/WarlocksTheGame/warlocks/]) that keeps telling us "This repository's size is over 1 GB. Read more on how to reduce the size of your repository."

git count-objects -v -H\\
responds with:

count: 0\\
size: 0 bytes\\
in-pack: 25\\
packs: 1\\
size-pack: 107.64 KiB\\
prune-packable: 0\\
garbage: 0\\
size-garbage: 0 bytes

I assume that's the same "issue" that was present in those issues:\\
[Issue 1|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9602/reported-repository-size-seems-wrong%3Futm_source%3DSAC%26utm_medium%3Ddashboard]\\
[Issue 2|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9844/repository-size-greater-than-1-gb-message%3Futm_source%3DSAC%26utm_medium%3Ddashboard]\\
and is related to the garbage collection. Would be nice if someone could force garbage collection on the repo.

Thanks in advance! :)\\
EB
fields.summary: Repository size greater than 1 GB message

fields.description:
I wanted to upload a file with a prepackaged binary to one of my public repositories to make it easier for users to find the correct files to use. However, when I dragged the binary file to the 'select a file' button of the upload screen, Chrome offered to download the file to me.

So it appears I have to click the button and navigate to the correct folder in the file browser instead of being able to just drop the correct upload on the button or the page.

Please note I'm talking about the /downloads page relative to the repository root.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Drag & drop uploading of downloadable files with repositories is not supported (BB-11119)

fields.description:
The search field in the home page is a nightmare:

• Since it has the key focus by default, when you press the space bar, instead of scrolling the page, it filters the repositories with the ' ' character.\\
• When it has the key focus, when you scroll down using the page down on the keyboard, the page scrolls up after a while. (Safari 6.1.4 just in case)

This, in addition to the sort by recent modification instead of sort by name, makes using the home page a nightmare as soon as you have a bunch of repositories.
fields.summary: Home page is a usability nightmare

fields.description:
A js error on bitbucket.js, line 161 occurs.

To reproduce, login in bitbucket and go to your account.

# Click on "SSH keys" and then add a new one
# Name your key and enter the credentials for your public key
# Click "Add key" and the bug occurs (the key is not added to my account)
fields.summary: Unable to add SSH keys to a user account

fields.description: My new repository is stuck on the 'Creating Repository' page. I've logged in and out, tried different machines, still the issue remains.
fields.summary: Repository stuck creating

fields.description: When I change team avatar on main team page my avatar in menu is also changed. It is temporarily - when I reload page team avatar is changed and my avatar is back.
fields.summary: team avatar changes aren't consistently reflected on mutation (BB-11117)

fields.description:
We tried to remove the repo:

https://bitbucket.org/lbl-cascade/iliad

but it got somehow stuck and now it is simply listed as "https://bitbucket.org/lbl-cascade/iliad" and it seems that we can't take any further management actions on the repo. Could you please remove the repo so that we can recreate it.

Thanks,

Oliver
fields.summary: repository unavailable.

fields.description:
I'm aware of other issues and know this is solved by sending referer header, I disabled this myself because i didn't want to website tracks my last location.\\
But I'm consider now what's related between CSRF verification and my last location?

ps. I thought it might be needed for OpenID verification, but I don't use it. I use the old way, simple username and password.
fields.summary: CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.

fields.description:
When pushing in a repo that has @mentions, the @mentions are triggered for each commit as the site walks the commit tree. I would like to suppress these as they have no context in a brand new repository.

When @mentions are triggered this way, it introduces a much higher chance of misfires - that is, notifications that are too old to be valid or are sent to the wrong user.
fields.summary: As a user, I want at-mentions in commits to be suppressed when a repo's commits are computed for the first time. (BB-11097)

fields.description:
I've tried to import a remote repo, which failed. Now I'm not able to delete the repo because it's trying to import it again every time I'm trying to access it.

Is there an easy way to get rid of that repo or does any of the admins here need to take care of such things ?

git@bitbucket.org:cq-design/magento-enterprise.git <- That's the repo I want to have deleted.

Your help is much appreciated.

Regards,\\
Clemens
fields.summary: Importing an repo fails - now I can't delete it.

fields.description:
see image for example.

Updated 1 line which just added a class to to an html <div> element and got the removal of all html special characters in my commit as well.
fields.summary: Online editor replaces html special characters with actual characters
delete me.

fields.description:
I'm developing and Android app (which I'll soon host on Bitbucket) and I\\
have decided to use ACRA for crash reports and issues. I need to know if\\
there is a way I can send ACRA reports to the issue tracker of my Bitbucket\\
repository. Also, I'd like to know if the issues can be sent anonymusly. If\\
not, with a custom name (instead of my username)

They sent me here, from [this page|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/bbs/problem-report-12022]
fields.summary: ACRA and Bitbucket
